to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
arm

sentences.english: But the most interesting is the two man standing arm didn't meet.
sentences.chinese: 而最有趣的是两人交臂而立也互不相见。

sentences.english: Be sad , and you lose them all .
sentences.chinese: 若悲伤感怀，你会与他们失之交臂。

sentences.english: "We always lose many chances we take in our lives.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是与生命中许多机会失之交臂。

sentences.english: Opportunity is rare, and wise man will never let it go by him.
sentences.chinese: 机会难得，聪明人从不失之交臂。

sentences.english: Once upon a time two peasants attempted to pass each other and their sledges became entangled.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，两个农夫正要交臂而过，他们的雪橇却勾。

sentences.english: 5〃He stood up straight with arms folded, and laughed at the cap hanging there on the pole.
sentences.chinese: 他交臂直立，笑看帽子挂在杆子上那个样子。

sentences.english: He stood up straight with arms folded, and laughed at the cap hanging there on the pole.
sentences.chinese: 他交臂直立，笑看帽子挂在杆子上那个样子。

sentences.english: Sorry a lot of exhibitors due to slow by half a beat missed.
sentences.chinese: 惋惜不少展商由于慢半拍失之交臂。

sentences.english: Opportunity is rare, and a wise man will never let it go by him.
sentences.chinese: 机会难得，聪明人从不交臂失之。
